faqs.question: How long does it take to adapt?
faqs.answer: Most people need a few weeks of gradual wear, speech practice, and small adjustments. We schedule reviews to smooth the transition.

faqs.question: Can I chew normally?
faqs.answer: You can eat a wide range of foods with practice, but very hard or sticky foods may remain challenging. We show techniques and assess if extra stabilisation would help.

faqs.question: When do you suggest chrome or PEEK instead of acrylic?
faqs.answer: If you have enough healthy teeth for support, chrome or PEEK partials can feel slimmer and more stable. We’ll explain when acrylic is still the better match.

faqs.question: Do I have to use adhesive?
faqs.answer: Some people prefer the reassurance of adhesive for longer days or meals. We focus on good fit first and show how to use adhesive lightly if needed.

faqs.question: What if I want more stability?
faqs.answer: We can explore selective implant support once you’ve experienced how the denture fits. Any recommendation is paced around comfort, healing, and your goals.

sections.title: Plan a denture that feels secure
sections.body: Book a calm consultation to compare acrylic, chrome, and PEEK options. If you later want added stability, we can talk through implant-retained choices at your pace.
